# MLImageSizeConstraint

**Class**

A list or range of sizes that augment an image constraint’s default size.

## Declaration

```swift
class MLImageSizeConstraint
```

## Overview

You use an `MLImageSizeConstraint` to express what image sizes of an image feature a model will accept as input or produce as output.

Use [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraint/type] to determine which properties describe what image sizes the model’s image feature expects as input or produces as output.

If `type` is:

- [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraintType/range], the image feature accepts any image that has a width in [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraint/pixelsWideRange] and a height in [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraint/pixelsHighRange].
- [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraintType/enumerated], the image feature accepts any image size listed in [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraint/enumeratedImageSizes].
- [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageSizeConstraintType/unspecified], the `MLImageSizeConstraint` instance is not configured and should be ignored. Instead, use the image feature’s default image size constraint, defined by [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageConstraint/pixelsWide] and [doc://com.apple.coreml/documentation/CoreML/MLImageConstraint/pixelsHigh].



## Determining relevant constraints

- **type**: Indicator of which properties to inspect for this image size constraint.
- **MLImageSizeConstraintType**: The modes that determine how the model defines a feature’s image size constraint.

## Accessing the image size ranges

- **pixelsWideRange**: The range of widths a model’s image feature accepts as input or produces as output.
- **pixelsHighRange**: The range of heights a model’s image feature accepts as input or produces as output.

## Accessing the enumerated image sizes

- **enumeratedImageSizes**: An array of image sizes a model’s image feature accepts as input or produces as output.
- **MLImageSize**: The width and height of an image feature size.

## Inspecting acceptable sizes

- **sizeConstraint**: Additional sizes this image feature supports.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
